body:
@perses 

Regarding semver, its semantics do not exactly apply to Go (a package should not have any breaking changes in order to not break its clients, so no **major** changes ever). If you want to commit breaking changes to an API, a new package (with a new name/ import path) needs to be created.

We can probably even find something simpler/more adequate than semver.

It will make solving any diamond dependency case easier.
